intro: Hieracium pignattianum, commonly known as the Pignattian Hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. It is often found in disturbed or marginal areas, and its growth can be invasive in certain regions.
